instructors.name: מר הילל קוברובסקי

instructors.name: מר ניצן לוי
instructors.description: בעל תואר ראשון B.Sc בהנדסת תכנה, ובעל תואר שני בממשל, עם התמחות בביטחון ולוחמה בטרור מאוניברסיטת רייכמן, מרצה מוסמך מטעם ISC2 ו-ISACA

summary: התוכנית להכשרת בכירים בניהול אבטחת מידע, סייבר ופרטיות, כוללת הכנה מלאה להסמכות הבינלאומיות: CISSP, CISM, CC, CIPP/E, C|CISO. התוכנית היא היחידה בישראל המעניקה שתי תעודות אוניברסיטאיות של CISO ושל DPO, ומכינה לקראת חמש הסמכות בינלאומיות. התוכנית מועברת בהדרכתם של בולטי המרצים בתחום, ועם סיומה הסטודנט מוכשר כמנהל אבטחת מידע וסייבר וכקצין הגנת הנתונים בחברות. התוכנית כוללת 270 שעות אקדמיות פרונטליות ומתקיימת בקמפוס אוניברסיטת בר-אילן, רמת גן. התוכנית מכסה תחומים כמו ניהול סיכונים, הגנת פרטיות, ארכיטקטורת אבטחה, ניהול זהויות וגישה, אבטחת תוכנה, אבטחת ענן, וניהול תגובה לאירועים.
full_text:
COURSE NAME: מנהל אבטחת מידע וסייבר CISO וקצין הגנת הנתונים DPO.

COURSE OVERVIEW: The program is designed to train senior executives in information security management, cybersecurity, and privacy. It includes full preparation for international certifications such as CISSP, CISM, CC, CIPP/E, and C|CISO. This is the only program in Israel offering two university certificates: CISO and DPO, and prepares students for five prestigious international certifications.

COURSE LEADERSHIP: The program is led by Mr. Eran Shaham, Director of the School of Hi-Tech and Cyber Security at Bar-Ilan University. Professional advisors include Mr. Oren Yeger, Attorney Efrat Greenboim, Mr. Nitzan Levy, and Mr. Hillel Koberovsky, all with extensive experience in teaching various information security and cybersecurity professions.

TARGET AUDIENCE: The course is aimed at information security managers seeking international certifications, individuals with backgrounds in systems, communication, information systems management, information security consulting, and graduates of CND/DevOps courses with a specialization in cybersecurity from Bar-Ilan University.

PREREQUISITES: Understanding of technical and managerial concepts in English and passing an admission interview with an academic advisor.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 15.01.2024.
- Duration: Approximately seven months.
- Schedule: Sundays and Wednesdays from 17:30 to 21:30.
- Academic Hours: 270 frontal academic hours.

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- Location: School of Hi-Tech and Cyber Security, Bar-Ilan University Campus, Ramat Gan.
- Some classes may be conducted via Zoom according to Home Front Command and university instructions.

TUITION AND FEES: 
- Registration Fee: 480 ₪.
- Tuition Fee: 16,500 ₪.
- The course includes original international study kits worth thousands of shekels.
- International certification exams are external and require separate payment.

CERTIFICATIONS AWARDED: Graduates receive two prestigious certificates from Bar-Ilan University: CISO (Certified Information Security Officer) and DPO (Certified Data Protection Officer). Additional certificates include INCD Cyber Defense Doctrine 2.0, ISC2 CC, ISC2 CISSP, and ISACA CISM.

COURSE TOPICS: The program consists of fourteen domains, each focusing on different aspects of the CISO role:
- Domain 1: Preparation, including understanding lab topologies and using defense and attack technologies.
- Domain 2: Security and Risk Management, covering confidentiality, integrity, availability, and risk management concepts.
- Domain 3: Asset Security, focusing on information and asset classification and security controls.
- Domain 4: Privacy, addressing data protection laws, personal data processing, and privacy governance.
- Domain 5: Information Security Governance, Program Development and Management, aligning security strategy with business goals.
- Domain 6: Security Architecture and Engineering, implementing secure design principles and assessing vulnerabilities.
- Domain 7: Communication and Network Security, focusing on secure network architectures and communication channels.
- Domain 8: Identity and Access Management (IAM), managing access to assets and identity lifecycle.
- Domain 9: Security Assessment and Testing, designing and validating security assessments and audits.
- Domain 10: Security Operations, supporting investigations and conducting logging and monitoring activities.
- Domain 11: Software Development Security, integrating security in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
- Domain 12: Cloud Security, covering cloud architecture, governance, and compliance.
- Domain 13: Incident Management and Response, developing processes for incident detection and response.
- Domain 14: Final Steps for becoming a CISO, including strategic planning and enterprise information security program development.
